channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: 情報筋バイス記者のサウジアラビアに関する批判的な報道は、サウジアラビアにいるスタッフの安全を懸念する企業幹部によって何度も阻止されている（Jim Waterson/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Jim Waterson / The Guardian:
Sources: Vice reporters' critical coverage of Saudi Arabia has been repeatedly blocked by corporate execs who cite concerns for safety of staff in Saudi Arabia  —  Exclusive: Media company recently signed lucrative deal with Saudi government-controlled MBC Group

item.title: 情報筋NYTの組合員がWaPoの組合員数十人にベストプラクティスについて説明、WaPoの組合員がウォークアウトを真剣に検討していることを示唆（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
Sources: NYT union members briefed several dozen staffers from the WaPo union about best practices, suggesting the latter is seriously considering a walkout  —  Members of the New York Times' union on Monday evening briefed several dozen staffers from The Washington Post union about best practices …

item.title: Eメール：Xは、広告主がフォロワーを獲得するために、プラットフォームのタイムライン内で自社のアカウントを宣伝することを認めなくなった。情報筋によると、そのような広告は年間1億ドルを生み出している（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
Email: X no longer lets advertisers promote their accounts within the platform's timeline to gain followers; a source says such ads generate $100M annually  —  X, the company formerly known as Twitter, will no longer allow advertisers to promote their accounts within the platform's timeline …

item.title: Substackは、ニュースレターを購読しなくても個々のライターをフォローできるようにした。
item.description:
Jay Peters / The Verge:
Substack now lets users follow individual writers without subscribing to their newsletter, a further expansion into social networking after Notes  —  Substack now lets you follow writers, offering a way for you to keep tabs on what a writer is doing without having to subscribe to their newsletter.

item.title: Pop CraveとPop Baseという2つのポップカルチャーXアカウントは、ニュース収集とアグリゲーションを行っており、クリックする必要性をなくしたヘッドラインを共有している（Christian Paz/Vox）
item.description:
Christian Paz / Vox:
A look at Pop Crave and Pop Base, two pop culture X accounts doing newsgathering and aggregation, and sharing headlines that eliminate the need to click through  —  Are Pop Crave and Pop Base the future of political journalism?  —  If you've spent any time on Instagram, Threads, or …

item.title: 広告会社CPABuildと結びついた詐欺が、ハッキングされた.gov、.org、.eduサイトで、検索エンジンにインデックスされた悪質なPDFをホストし、多くの場合、フォートナイトやRobloxのユーザーを誘い込む方法（Matt Burgess/Wired）
item.description:
Matt Burgess / Wired:
How a scam tied to ad firm CPABuild hosts malicious PDFs, indexed by search engines, on hacked .gov, .org, and .edu sites, often luring Fortnite or Roblox users  —  The wide-ranging scams, often disguised as game promotions, can all be linked back to one network.

item.title: ロイター通信は、ジョージア州でのトランプ氏に対する告訴の可能性に関する報道を、出典として引用した文書が裁判所のウェブサイトから削除されたことを受け、明らかにした（ケイティ・ロバートソン／ニューヨーク・タイムズ）。
item.description:
Katie Robertson / New York Times:
Reuters clarifies its report on possible charges against Trump in Georgia, after a document it cited as its source was removed from the court's website  —  A document that Reuters cited as its source disappeared and the news organization walked back its reporting.

item.title: 情報源：AMPTPが視聴者ストリーミングデータの共有、20％以上の残留支払い増、1年目の基本給5％増を含む新契約を作家に提示（ブルームバーグ）
item.description:
Bloomberg:
Sources: the AMPTP offers writers a new deal that includes sharing viewer streaming data, a 20%+ residual payments increase, and a 5% base pay hike in year one  —  - New proposal includes sharing of viewer data on streaming  — Media companies assure screenwriters AI won't replace them

item.title: 提出書類：バイデン政権、フロリダ州とテキサス州の法律の重要部分を見直すよう連邦最高裁に要請（Greg Stohr/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Greg Stohr / Bloomberg:
Filing: the Biden administration urges SCOTUS to review key parts of Florida's and Texas' laws meant to restrict how social media companies can moderate content  —  - Biden administration urges review of laws in Texas, Florida  — Filing largely backs social media challenges to state laws

item.title: Simplify InventionsがSports IllustratedのオーナーであるArena Groupの株式〜65％を購入する計画。この取引には$50Mの投資と5年間〜$60Mの広告コミットメントが含まれる（Alexandra Bruell/Wall Street Journal）
item.description:
Alexandra Bruell / Wall Street Journal:
Simplify Inventions plans to buy a ~65% stake in Sports Illustrated owner Arena Group; the deal includes a $50M investment and a five-year ~$60M ad commitment  —  Manoj Bhargava's Simplify Inventions will take a roughly 65% stake in the Arena Group  —  Manoj Bhargava, a businessman who founded …

item.title: BarstoolのCEO、エリカ・エアーズ・バダンへのインタビュー。ペンとの契約、「端っこの心地よさ」への回帰、サイトをビジネスにすることなどについて（Emily Jane Fox/Vanity Fair）。
item.description:
Emily Jane Fox / Vanity Fair:
An interview with Barstool CEO Erika Ayers Badan, on the Penn deal, returning to “being comfortable on the edge”, building the site into a business, and more  —  As Penn pivots from Portnoy's brand of bro-ish excess to family-friendly ESPN, Barstool is free to be itself.

item.title: Netflix、クラウドストリーミングゲームの "限定ベータテスト "をカナダと英国で開始（Jay Peters/The Verge）
item.description:
Jay Peters / The Verge:
Netflix begins a “limited beta test” of its cloud-streamed games on the web, TVs, and streaming devices from Roku, LG, Amazon, and more, in Canada and the UK  —  Netflix is kicking off the first public tests of its cloud-streamed games. … In a blog post, Netflix VP …

item.title: CBSがCBSニュースの社長にイングリッド・シプリアン＝マシューズを指名、新任のウェンディ・マクマホン直属に（Kayla Cobb/The Wrap）
item.description:
Kayla Cobb / The Wrap:
CBS names Ingrid Ciprian-Matthews as the president of CBS News, reporting directly to the newly appointed Wendy McMahon  —  This appointment comes in the wake of Wendy McMahon becoming president and CEO of CBS News and Stations  —  Ingrid Ciprian-Matthews has been named the new president of CBS News.

item.title: ニューヨーク・タイムズ紙は、新規購読者をニュースのみの購読から遠ざけ、5つの消費者向け商品からなるオール・アクセス・バンドルの販売に力を注いでいる（Bron Maher/Press Gazette）。
item.description:
Bron Maher / Press Gazette:
The New York Times is steering new subscribers away from buying a news-only subscription, leaning into pushing its All Access bundle of five consumer products  —  If you don't like the word “bundle”, don't listen in on a The New York Times earnings call.  —  In prepared remarks …

item.title: CBSは、ニーラジ・ケムラニ氏がCBSの制作契約を追求するために退任した後、ウェンディ・マクマホン氏をCBS News and StationsおよびCBS Media Venturesの社長兼CEOに指名した（Ted Johnson/Deadline）
item.description:
Ted Johnson / Deadline:
CBS names Wendy McMahon as president and CEO of CBS News and Stations and CBS Media Ventures, after Neeraj Khemlani stepped down to pursue a CBS production deal  —  Wendy McMahon will take on sole duties leading CBS News and stations while adding oversight of the network's domestic syndication business.
